availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph J. Hedrick (Clark co., OH, and Brown Co., IL, painter and soldier (5th OVI) )

body.p: Clark County, Ohio, and Brown County, Illinois, painter and soldier. Ohio native. Son of Isaac Hedrick and Catherine Hedrick. Student in Clark County, Ohio, in 1850. Painter in Cooperstown, Illinois, in 1860. Painter in Clark County in 1863. Served in the 5th Ohio Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.).

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Clark County, Madison, p. 153B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Illinois, Brown County, Cooperstown, p. 736.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Clark County, OH, June & July 1863, p. 137.
"Joseph J. Hedrick (1838-1911)," Find A Grave, Memorial #41614774, accessed August 24, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/41614774.
